results.title: Levantes
results.creator_credit: Kalokairi Pictures, Lisa Horler and Fionn Skiotis
results.brief_description: ‘Levantes’ (translation from the Greek: East Wind) is a personal essay combining documentary images with a fictional narration. It tells the story of a young Greek Australian man travelling through Greece and Turkey, crossing the border to avoid army service. His impressions and reflections on the legacy of the region are told in an intimate monologue that he addresses to a friend back home in Australia. He talks about Greece, the journey, himself and his friend and the two nations, Greece and Turkey, which are as close as they are wide apart.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kalokairi Pictures, Lisa Horler and Fionn Skiotis

results.title: Letyat zhuravli = The Cranes are flying
results.brief_description:
An anti-war love story set during the early years of World War II, ‘The Cranes Are Flying’ is a romantic drama about love, loss and recovery from catastrophe. When a young hospital worker hears that her fiance has been killed in the war, she is traumatised and refuses to believe it. Raped by a distant cousin during an air raid, she eventually marries him, despite feeling no love, and continues to mourn for her dead lover. A subsequent turn of events re-establishes her faith in life and her confidence returns. Winner of Best Film at the Cannes Film Festival, 1958

Credits: Producer, director, Mikhail Kalatozov ; writer, Victor Rosov ; photography, Sergei Urusevski ; music, M. Vainberg ; editing, Mariya Timofeyeva.
Cast: Tatiana Samoilova, Alexei Batalov, Vasily Merkuryev, Alexander Shvorin, Svetlana Kharitonova, Konstantin Nikitin.

results.title: Letting in the jungle
results.brief_description: A visit to Kolmarden Zoological Park in Sweden where wild animals from all over the world live free in surroundings reminiscent of a national park. Includes a sequence depicting Siberian tigers at play in the snow. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Letting go
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian Film Corporation and Anne Whitehead
results.brief_description: This drama explores the communication difficulties and differences in values between the generations in a fairly typical Australian family. Conflict reaches a crisis point when the seventeen-year-old daughter decides to leave home and live with her boyfriend. Cast includes: Robyn Nevin, John Ewart, Karena Menzie, Miranda Cartledge, Jeremy Scrivener, Phillip Priest.

results.title: Letters to Ali [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Lunar Films, Eddie L.C. Fong and Clara Law
results.brief_description: Remarkable work, that is part road-movie, about an Australian family who befriend an Afghanistan refugee (via letters), held in Port Hedland, their relationship with him and their attempts to free him. Clara Law (Goddess of 1967) accompanies the family on a 12,000 kilometre round trip taken to visit Ali, exploring the dynamics of the family and laying bare the cruel bureaucracy of the Australian government that holds refugees in detention centres for limitless periods, under dire conditions. A ponderous and significant work that contains moments of beauty whilst conveying the pain and anguish of all involved. Also available on VHS [318951].
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lunar Films, Eddie L.C. Fong and Clara Law

results.title: Letters from Poland
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Mark Stiles and Sophia Turkiewicz
results.brief_description: The story of a young Polish immigrant and her struggle to build a new life in the harsh environment of post World War II Sydney. The film raises a number of themes: the loneliness of being in a foreign land; the special isolation of a migrant woman and the dislocation of a single mother needing to support both herself and her child. Cast includes Bashia Bonkowski, Martin Vaughan, Jessica O’Donnell, Arthur Krawczynski, Tracy Ellis. Photography: Martha Ansara

results.title: Letterboxes: the inside story
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Catherine South
results.brief_description: An engaging and humorous look at the significance of the letterbox in urban life. The letterboxes we see are of all different shapes and sizes. Their owners tell why they chose them and the impact the mail delivery has on their daily lives.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Catherine South

results.title: Letter writing at work
results.brief_description: Often the impression conveyed in a letter is very different from the one intended, and the message is muddled and confusing. This can be disastrous when a letter is written at work, or when it is sent on behalf of a company or other organisation. The film is intended to be shown to clerks, office supervisors and managers, in fact for everyone who has to write letters during their working day. It sets out to show that there is no secret art to writing effective business letters, but that there are some basic rules which can be followed in almost every case.
